October 6, 2016, Lauren reported directly to Andrew

I had the pleasure of working for Andrew's company as a sales rep. It's no surprise that Biz Apps has grown so much in such a short time under his leadership. He fosters a work environment that is high-energy, collaborative, and down-right enjoyable. I believe a lot of his success is due to his innate ability to relate to all people - employees, customers, partners, on a very human level, although he is quick to attribute his success to those around him. He's as humble as he is visionary. He's the kind of leader that will sit down, pick up your phone, and make a call for you before he heads to his exec meeting, just because. It was truly a pleasure to work with you and for you Gaz!

I met Andrew in his senior year at college as he was getting BiznessApps off the ground. Over the following several years, I've seen him build a team and a company that is among one of the leaders in its space, having reached the Inc 500 list of America's fastest growing companies twice. Andrew is a hard-working and resilient entrepreneur, with good instincts, and is not afraid to try new things. It has been energizing to be part of the BiznessApps journey and I look forward to more great things to come.

August 23, 2016, Andrew was senior to Max but didn’t manage directly

This summer I had the absolute privilege of working for Andrew as a Bizness Apps intern—To say I learned a lot would be an understatement.Andrew’s leadership abilities are bar none. I was continually blown away by his ability to steer Bizness Apps towards growth, all awhile ensuring that each and every employee was utilized to full potential. Andrew genuinely connects with and inspires those he works with, while working hard to maintain a collaborative and selfless office atmosphere. Andrew is the epitome of a boss leading by example, and never fails to put his team and customer first. I could go on and when explaining Andrew’s impact on myself and Bizness Apps, and have no doubt that success will continue to follow him for years to come.

Tyler Lang
Account Executive at Bannerman
August 12, 2016, Tyler reported directly to Andrew

I have been working with Andrew at Bizness Apps for almost two years now. As a new college graduate with a very slim resume, Andrew took a gamble hiring me back in 2014. With his guidance and leadership, I have now established myself as a successful salesperson- which I owe to Andrew’s confidence in my ability to learn and grow. He is a great mentor and an even better friend. For anyone looking to join a company with a bright future and a strong leader, look no further. Bizness Apps was an amazing place for me to begin my career, and the company’s success as well as my own are due entirely to Andrew’s drive and passion to improve every day.

I had the pleasure of working for Andrew at Bizness Apps for 3 years as both a Customer Support Representative and Account Executive on the sales team. I can honestly say that it was the best 3 years of my professional experience. My voice was always heard and was always encouraged. I truly felt like a real member of something greater than myself and Andrew always drove me to strive for high success and my individual and team triumphs were recognized regularly and always made my efforts feel appreciated and added to my work ethic. His guidance and knowledge about everything tech, leadership, and pure business intelligence will always be remembered and carried with me throughout my career! He is and was to me a great mentor, boss, colleague, and friend, and anyone that has the pleasure to work at Bizness Apps will know full well what I mean.

Benjamin Becker
Customer Success Leader Seeking New Opportunities
July 26, 2016, Benjamin reported directly to Andrew

Andrew was a tirelessly hard working CEO who was truly devoted to the success of his business and the well-being of his employees. He was always thinking of new strategies to try and pushing himself to learn more about the market and business trends.Not only did he make sure his company was an enjoyable and stable place to work, he also went through great pains to make sure it was a stimulating environment in which people could learn and grow, even if they had no prior experience. He was great at identifying fresh talent for the team and setting goals and expectations such that new hires would be pushed to achieve their best without feeling under-qualified or discouraged. Andrew was also great at identifying the strengths of his staff members and allowing them to move into roles that would better suit their skills and interests.Not only was Andrew a great CEO in that he made his company a great place to work, he was also an excellent businessman who made decisive choices and had excellent evaluation processes.

Ana, to put it simply, is one of the best employees I have ever had the pleasure of working with. Over the 3-years I worked with Ana I was lucky enough to see her evolve into a true professional and leader within the company. At one point she was managing a team of 10-15+ CS employees as well as our in-house design team. I could go on and on and on about Ana but every task that we gave to Ana, she absolutely knocked it out of the park. If you have the chance to work with Ana, please do not second guess yourself, and hire her immediately! And to top it all off, Ana brings an attitude to any company that makes others enjoy the day to day, which I appreciated every single day when working with Ana. She truly is a rock star!

summary: Andrew Gazdecki wants to simplify small business.He is the founder and CEO of Bizness Apps — making mobile apps affordable and simple for small businesses. We’re a do-it-yourself iPhone, iPad, Android & HTML5 app platform that allows any small business to simultaneously create, edit, and manage mobile apps without any programming knowledge needed. Think of us as “WordPress for mobile app creation.” Many of our customers are marketing or design agencies that use our platform to cost effectively build mobile apps for small business clients.A graduate from CSU Chico, Gazdecki has been an entrepreneur for as long as he can remember. At the age of 10, he was selling baseball cards to neighborhood friends, and at the age 15, Andrew created his first for-profit website. In 2009, Andrew founded and bootstrapped Bizness Apps into a global enterprise all while he was a senior in college. Since then, he has gone on to help more than 500,000 small businesses engage with their customers on mobile devices.#58 INC 500 Fastest Growing Companieshttp://www.inc.com/profile/bizness-appsToday, Gazdecki is the authority on mobile marketing for small and medium sized businesses. He has been featured in The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Inc.com, and Entrepreneur Magazine, as well as prominent industry blogs such as Mashable, TechCrunch and VentureBeat. A firm believer in education, Gazdecki offers frequent presentations and donations to his alma mater, and contributes to the school’s Entrepreneurship Week, which gives students the tools and resources to bring their businesses to fruition.
name: Andrew Gazdecki
title: CEO at Bizness Apps
